list_translation_mean.translate_mean: sự cho phép được tự do
sự đổ xô mua cổ phần

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the dog ran across the road

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: pass or cause to pass quickly or smoothly in a particular direction.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the rumor ran through the pack of photographers
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Tin đồn chạy qua gói nhiếp ảnh gia

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (with reference to a liquid) flow or cause to flow.
extend or cause to extend in a particular direction.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: cobbled streets run down to a tiny harbor
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Đường phố rải sỏi chạy xuống một bến cảng nhỏ

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of a bus, train, ferry, or other form of transportation) make a regular journey on a particular route.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: buses run into town every half hour
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Xe buýt chạy vào thị trấn mỗi nửa giờ

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: be in charge of; manage.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: Andrea runs her own catering business
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Andrea điều hành doanh nghiệp ăn uống của riêng mình

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: be in or cause to be in operation; function or cause to function.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the car runs on unleaded fuel
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Chiếc xe chạy trên nhiên liệu không chì

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: continue or be valid or operative for a particular period of time.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the course ran for two days
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Khóa học chạy trong hai ngày

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: be a candidate in a political election.
publish or be published in a newspaper or magazine.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Những lá cải đã chạy câu chuyện

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: bring (goods) into a country illegally and secretly; smuggle.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: they run drugs for the cocaine cartels
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Họ chạy thuốc cho các cartel cocaine

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: an act or spell of running.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: I usually go for a run in the morning
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Tôi thường đi chạy vào buổi sáng

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a journey accomplished or route taken by a vehicle, aircraft, or boat, especially on a regular basis.
an opportunity or attempt to achieve something.
a continuous spell of a particular situation or condition.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he's had a run of bad luck
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh ấy đã chạy xui xẻo

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a widespread and sudden or continuous demand for (a particular currency or commodity).
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: there's been a big run on nostalgia toys this year
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Có một cuộc chạy lớn trên đồ chơi Nostalgia trong năm nay

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: the average or usual type of person or thing.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she stood out from the general run of varsity cheerleaders
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô đứng ra từ cuộc chạy chung của đội cổ vũ Varsity

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a sloping snow-covered course or track used for skiing, bobsledding, or tobogganing.
an enclosed area in which domestic animals or birds can run freely in the open.
free and unrestricted use of or access to.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: her cats were given the run of the house
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Mèo của cô đã được đưa ra khỏi nhà

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a point scored by hitting the ball so that both batsmen are able to run between the wickets, or awarded in some other circumstances.
a downward trickle of paint or a similar substance when applied too thickly.
diarrhoea.
the after part of a ship's bottom where it rises and narrows toward the stern.
